awards.title: Distinguished Service Award
awards.description:
UVC's award presented for outstanding service and achievement on behalf of the Veterans & Family Members of Colorado. Award was presented by Acting Secretary of Veterans Affairs Sloan Gibson. 

To activate and represent member organizations, speaking with one unified voice in Colorado; to work with and educate state and federal elected and appointed public policy makers to ensure support for veteran issues and concerns; and to inform/educate Colorado citizens about the needs of veterans, active duty armed service members and their families.

UVC is a non-partisan, non-profit organization.

https://uvcoc.org/

profile_positions.company: VA Eastern Colorado Health Care System
profile_positions.description:
Voluntary Service Officer for one of the largest Department of Veterans Affairs health care systems, which includes a central medical center and 14 community clinics & other facilities. Also VISN19 Voluntary Service Liaison, which advises and coaches seven Voluntary Service Officers in five states to ensure regulatory compliance of VA Voluntary Service (VAVS) programs.
·	Manages over 900 Regular Service Volunteers, to include screening & intake, training in required VA programs and policies, matching requests from clinical services with prospective volunteers, and resolving conflicts between Volunteers, VA staff and patients. 
·	Utilizes VA Voluntary Service Software (VSS) to analyze trends in volunteer enrollment & discharge, hours served in ECHCS facilities, and donations (including cash, in-kind and physical items) to support VA Eastern Colorado clinical programs. 
·	Develops local Patient Experience & Employee Engagement initiatives such as the Red Coat Ambassador Program, free financial education & competency classes, and free Yoga daytime classes for Veterans and VA Staff. 
·	Conducts Veteran Service Organization (VSO) & community stakeholder meetings, VAVS Advisory Committee quarterly meetings, private partner, Federal agency and community events to build coalitions & to inform stakeholders about VAVS programs and initiatives. 
·	Attends and presents VAVS policy & initiatives to State and Chartered VSO & Auxiliary events in the catchment area, to include State conventions, regional conferences and individual Post & Chapter meetings. 
·	Solicits, accepts and manages over $500,000 in monetary donations from VSO, Community stakeholders and individual & corporate donors. 
·	Coordinates with Public Affairs Officer on celebrity, governmental, military, corporate and Veteran Service Organization appearances at VA facilities.
profile_positions.title: Chief of Voluntary Services

profile_positions.company: VA Eastern Colorado Health Care System
profile_positions.description:
Public Affairs Officer for one of the largest Department of Veterans Affairs health care systems, which includes a central medical center and 14 community clinics & other facilities. 
·	Analyzed departmental policies & regulations and VA manual requirements to ensure regulatory compliance of Public Affairs programs. 
·	Planned and developed media and community relations programs, which included news releases, press conferences, community events, interviews and briefings. 
·	Published monthly Veteran Service Organization/Stakeholder newsletter and weekly internal communication newsletter to communicate Executive Leadership & VHA key policies and initiatives. 
·	Planned and executed crisis communications plans for multiple high-profile media incidents. 
·	Conducted Veteran & community stakeholder meetings, town halls and outreach/community events to inform and educate about VA programs.
·	Interacted and resolved disputes with Veterans & family members with complaints and policy questions for the Executive Leadership Team. 
·	Collaborated with Voluntary Services on celebrity, governmental, Military, and VSO appearances at VA facilities.
·	Utilized extensive knowledge of the organization structure of the VA Eastern Colorado health care system and its programs to pitch story ideas to media outlets on VHA program goals and VA Eastern Colorado’s clinical mission to Veterans.
·	Collaborated closely with Patient Experience Liaisons on SHEP report data and individual complaints to identify possible media & Congressional issues.
·	Analyzed traditional Broadcast, Print, Online and Social Media for potential problems and opportunities for program staff. 
·	Advised Executive Leadership Team on weekly, monthly and quarterly basis on current media, stakeholder and community trends and climate towards VA.
profile_positions.title: Public Affairs Officer

profile_positions.description:
Volunteer Denver Metro chair of the State Advisory Committee on Jail Diversion & Trauma Recovery, Priority to Veterans (JDTR) grant, Colorado Department of Health & Human Services, Division of Behavioral Health. Grant was funded by the US Dept of Health and Human Services Substance Abuse & Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA). I was part of the advisory team that established two Veterans Trauma Court at District Level (18th & 4th) and established the operating principals for the remainder in the State of Colorado. 
·	Responsible for the invitation, agenda, and outreach for the State’s Denver Metro area advisory committee on Veteran Treatment Court.
·	Coordinated with local community and Veteran stakeholders to recruit and retain volunteer peer support specialists and other staff for multiple Veteran Treatment Courts.
·	Established and maintained effective working relationships with local law enforcement, judicial, Veteran & community stakeholders and non-profit agencies to identify areas of matching priorities and services in the identification and treatment of veterans with Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) and Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI).
·	Selected to present at SAMSHA Veteran Treatment Court & Peer Support conferences.
·	Co-presenter of “Taking off the Pack - PTSI, TBI and the Returning Veteran” free speaker’s program presented by JDTR grant to Judiciary, Public Safety, First Responders, Social Work, Academic and other Veteran-involved audiences.
·	Identifies opportunities to work with higher education, judiciary and other Veteran Treatment Court stakeholders for training on issues facing returning veterans.
·	Communicates with local media for opportunities to present positive coverage of Veteran Treatment Court activities.
profile_positions.title: Chair, State Advisory Committee on Veterans Treatment Court

Responsible for the pre-production, art direction, editing, audio sweetening and final edit of all US Courts audio/video productions. Responsible for the scheduling, supervision and training of three video editors. Works with Office of Public Affairs to review and recommend new video & audio editing, graphics, 2D & 3D animation, image adjustment, video compression, video server and print creation application software and hardware.
profile_positions.title: Senior Video Editor/Art Director US Courts
